AD and AP do not have the same value per stat. Surprisingly enough, most adc's and apc's can still be assassinated and are still priority targets.

And as of today, Cho'Gath is the 13th most popular mid laner, and the rest are squishies.

Tank supports have always been popular, even in the assassin meta. Leona, Thresh (when built tank) are still dominant, with Janna, Morgana, and Blitzcrank in tow. Nautilus is climbing in popularity, however, but is nowhere near overbearing followed by Braum in seventh and Alistar in eighth.

Top lane and jungle, I get, but how is this a tank meta? Of course each team needs at least one tank, the same way you need at least two carries for damage and a support for cc or sustain. Or was having three assassins per team more healthy?

3 assassins per team was my norm, but it was horrible. poor leona support trying to tank, front line and peel for adc, while Yi, Trydamere and Yasuo dive into the enemy like numbnuts, racing each other for kills instead of working together. I recently did a champ composition comparison. While it's easy to win a game without an assassin, it's hard if you have more than one. The enemy should preferably have one tank, and one tough fighter, or two tanks and an assassin. 3 assassins by all logic was always bad, in pretty much all games. But League of Assassins pulled it off, then they made it that tanks could survive assassins, and people think this is Tank meta? No, this is League of Legends, the most balanced it has been in years (teams with 3 tanks have as hard a game as teams with 3 assassins, team composition means diversity), if this was league of tanks, we'd just have 4 tanks and an adc every game and go ape s**t

Well put. For the longest time teams had no tanks and didn't suffer for it. It was a contest of who had the most burst in their team and then who caught out who. People complain about the tank meta as if all other champs are nonviable, yet having a tank to cc for your assassin to kill the enemies is way more effective than a ton of assassins. Still people act like assassins can't be played. The only tank that is really an issue anymore is sej and she is getting yet another nerf to her damage. The fact is, an assassin that knows what he is doing will always be useful as the ability to take out the enemies sustained damage in a fight before they can dish out much damage is a very useful tool. There is no tank meta, people just aren't used to not one shotting the entire enemy team.

The article that Riot wrote specifically references professional and high-level play, and in these levels of play assassins have really fallen off because players know how to deal with these assassins and work with tanks.

At low levels of play, you are going to see a lot of assassins dominate because players can't deal with them.
lolwut LeBlanc and Zed are amazing in LCS.

In the LCS, he's already seeing decreased popularity not because of the nerfs, but because Urgot and Cho'Gath have found their niche as midlane anti-assassins.

Otherwise, Zed is still very relevant as an assassin with great waveclear, safety and poke. He just has to be more patient about going in on teamfights instead of constantly trying to make plays—something all assassins should have to do (and curiously enough, something from which LeBlanc is disappointingly still exempt).

Tank Meta is best meta because you have a lot of items in the game to play around it like Tenacity, Penetration for Armor and Magic Resist, and % Health items. Most other metas will be much more annoying since there isn't anti-armor penetration or anti-magic resist penetration meaning other metas just zone out some champions entirely. Tank Meta lets most champions be competitive besides a few REALLY single target Assassins, but they mainly just need reworks or buffs (Shaco and the lot).
